News.Title: BGR Energy Contract Terminated by TANTRANSCO
News.Summary: Tamil Nadu Transmission Corporation Limited terminated BGR Energy Systems' EPC contract for 230/110 KV substation project due to alleged delays. Company examining legal options.

News.Title: BGR Energy Reports ₹3,968 Cr Total Debt as of Dec 2025
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems disclosed total financial indebtedness of ₹3,968.11 crores as of December 31, 2025, with outstanding bank loans of ₹3,534.93 crores and no defaults reported.

News.Title: BGR Energy Gets ₹32.11 Cr GST Demand Order
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems receives GST order demanding ₹32.11 crores for period April 2018 to March 2021. Company plans to file appeal against the order from Joint Commissioner of GST.

News.Title: BGR Energy Gets GST Demand of ₹32.72 Lakh for FY22
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems receives GST demand order of ₹32.72 lakh from Joint Commissioner, Kanpur for alleged turnover suppression and incorrect place of supply determination in FY 2021-22.

News.Title: BGR Energy Gets ₹4.46 Cr GST Demand Order
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems receives GST demand order worth ₹4.46 crores from Gujarat tax authorities for alleged under-reporting of taxable turnover across FY 2018-19, 2022-23 and 2023-24.

News.Title: BGR Energy Receives GST Appeal Order Worth ₹1.72 Cr
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems receives Order-in-Appeal from CGST Commissioner involving disputed Input Tax Credit of ₹1.69 crores and interest of ₹3.64 lakhs for July 2017-March 2020 period.

News.Title: BGR Energy Faces ₹3.31 Cr GST Demand from CGST Nellore
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems receives GST demand order of ₹1.65 cr with equal penalty for alleged wrong ITC availment during FY19-21. Company plans to appeal the Commissioner's order.

News.Title: BGR Energy Systems Promoter Gifts 2,100 Shares to Mother in Family Transfer
News.Summary: Promoter Arjun Govind Raghupathy gifted 2,100 equity shares (0.00291% shareholding) to his mother Sasikala Raghupathy through an off-market transfer on December 4, 2025. The voluntary disclosure involves a family arrangement between two promoters of BGR Energy Systems Limited, with Arjun's holding reducing from 4,320 to 2,220 shares while Sasikala's increased from nil to 2,100 shares.

News.Title: BGR Energy Systems Reports Quarterly Loss Amid Debt Restructuring and Contract Disputes
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems posted losses in its quarterly results ended September 30, 2025, while nine public sector banks assigned the company's outstanding dues to NARCL for debt restructuring. The company faces ongoing contract disputes including a Rs. 80,462 lakhs claim with NUPPL and received a termination order from TANGEDCO, creating material uncertainty about its going concern status.

News.Title: BGR Energy Systems Reports Reduced Net Loss Despite Flat Revenue Growth
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems reported a net loss of 617.3 million rupees for Q2, significantly lower than the previous year's loss of 1.92 billion rupees. The company's quarterly revenue reached 832.5 million rupees compared to 825 million rupees in the same period last year.

News.Title: BGR Energy Systems Receives GST Demand Order of Rs. 36.14 Lakh for Excess ITC Claims
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems Limited received a demand order from the Assistant Commissioner, Bhubaneswar Division for excess Input Tax Credit (ITC) of Rs. 36,14,294 for FY 2022-23 under Section 73 of CGST Act 2017/OGST Act, 2017. The company also faces a penalty of Rs. 3,68,940. The adjudicating authority partially accepted the company's defense by dropping the FY 2021-22 demand of Rs. 64,21,696 after verification showed no excess ITC was availed for that period. The excess ITC amount comprises IGST Rs. 34,89,396, CGST Rs. 62,449, and SGST Rs. 62,449. BGR Energy Systems plans to file an appeal before the Appellate Authority against the confirmed demand.

News.Title: GMR Energy Raises Rs 1,600 Crore Through High-Yield Debt at 14.85%
News.Summary: GMR Energy raised Rs 1,600 crore through five-year non-convertible debt priced at 14.85%. The issue attracted investors including Allianz Global, Trust, and DSP Finance. The coupon rate is more than twice the existing risk-free rate on comparable duration. Proceeds will be used to partly repay existing loans and extend intra-group lending. Some investors plan to offload portions of the debt in the secondary market to large foreign banks and family offices. The higher cost reflects the holding company structure and reduced foreign bank interest in thermal power producers. GMR Group has been increasing its stake in GMR Energy, rising from 58% to nearly 87% after acquiring Tenaga Nasional's 29% stake and signing a deal for Temasek's 12% stake, which will make it almost 99% owned. The company operates four power assets including GMR Kamalanga (1,050 MW thermal) and GMR Warora (600 MW thermal). GMR's airport business separately raised Rs 6,000 crore across two tranches at rates of 10.35% and 10.50%.

News.Title: BGR Energy Systems Reports Widening Net Loss of Rs 266 Crore in Q1 FY2026
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems reported a net loss of Rs 266.03 crore in Q1 FY2026, significantly higher than the Rs 111.68 crore loss in Q1 FY2025. Revenue declined 49% year-on-year to Rs 88.61 crore. The company's EBITDA loss widened to Rs 80.79 crore compared to a profit of Rs 0.49 crore in the previous year quarter. Loss per share increased to Rs 36.74 from Rs 15.72. Total liabilities rose to Rs 6,563.27 crore while net worth remained negative at Rs 1,905.51 crore. Auditors raised material uncertainty about the company's going concern status due to continuous cash losses, negative net worth, and delays in debt repayments. The Construction and EPC Contracts segment contributed 87% of revenue at Rs 77.44 crore, while Capital Goods segment generated Rs 11.17 crore. Promoters infused unsecured loans of Rs 433.18 crore to support operations. The company received a termination order from one customer and is pursuing a Rs 804.62 crore claim with NUPPL for additional work. Management is in discussions with bankers for a restructuring package. S. Pattabiraman will step down as CFO, with S. Sundar appointed as his replacement.

News.Title: BGR Energy Systems Reports Financial Results for Quarter Ended June 30, 2025
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems Limited published its unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025 in Business Standard and Prajasakti newspapers. The company reported total income from operations of Rs 8,861 lakhs on standalone basis and Rs 8,861 lakhs on consolidated basis. The company recorded net losses after tax of Rs 26,302 lakhs (standalone) and Rs 26,603 lakhs (consolidated) for the quarter. Basic earnings per share stood at negative Rs 36.45 for standalone and negative Rs 36.74 for consolidated results. The equity share capital remained at Rs 7,216 lakhs with face value of Rs 10 per share. The results were reviewed by the Audit Committee and approved by the Board of Directors on August 14, 2025.

News.Title: BGR Energy Systems Reports Wider Net Loss and Revenue Decline in Q1
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems reported a net loss of 2.6 billion rupees in Q1, significantly higher than the 1.18 billion rupee loss in the same period last year. The company's revenue fell to 886 million rupees compared to 1.74 billion rupees in the previous year's corresponding quarter, representing a substantial year-over-year decline.

News.Title: GMR Energy Plans to Raise $184 Million Through Five-Year Bond Issue
News.Summary: GMR Energy plans to raise 16 billion rupees ($184 million) through five-year bonds, offering investors an internal rate of return of 14.60%. The company serves as the holding firm for GMR Kamalanga Energy and GMR Warora Energy, which operate thermal power plants. The bond issue targets alternative investment firms, foreign investors, and foreign banks. Proceeds will be used for inter-group lending, including repayment of existing loans. The bonds will be redeemed in installments: 20% each at the end of the third and fourth years, and 60% at the end of the fifth year. The issue includes a put option starting February 2028 and a make-whole call provision allowing buyback of 5 billion rupees within 12 months and the remaining 11 billion rupees within 21 months. GMR Energy previously raised funds through bonds in December 2023.

News.Title: BGR Energy Systems Receives Contract Termination for Rs 2,600 Crore Power Project
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems Limited received a contract termination letter from Tamil Nadu Power Generation Corporation Ltd for a Rs 2,600.02 crore EPC contract related to the North Chennai Super Critical Thermal Power Project. The termination was due to the contractor's inability to fulfill key project obligations, incomplete critical systems, and failure to meet contractual requirements for insurance renewals and guarantee extensions. The project involved establishment of 1 x 800 MW North Chennai Super Critical Thermal Power Project, Stage III – Balance of Plant package along with allied civil works. BGR Energy stated there is no major impact on the company's financials or operations and mentioned that an arbitration application is pending before the High Court of Madras.

News.Title: BGR Energy Systems Reports Q4 Net Loss of 3.3B Rupees
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems has reported a net loss of 3.3 billion rupees in the latest quarter, compared to a loss of 1.33 billion rupees in the same quarter last year. This represents an increase in losses year-over-year. Sequentially, the loss has widened from 3.4 billion rupees in the previous quarter. The company's revenue for the quarter stood at 1.3 billion rupees, down from 1.70 billion rupees in the corresponding quarter of the previous year.

News.Title: SBI Concludes Forensic Audit of BGR Energy Systems, Finds No Fraud
News.Summary: State Bank of India (SBI) has completed a forensic audit of BGR Energy Systems and found no evidence of fraud. As a result, SBI has declared BGR Energy's account as 'no fraud', clearing the company of any financial misconduct allegations.

News.Title: SBI Concludes Forensic Audit of BGR Energy Systems
News.Summary: State Bank of India (SBI) has completed a forensic audit of BGR Energy Systems. The audit found no evidence of fraud in the company's account. As a result, SBI has declared BGR Energy's account as 'No Fraud'.

News.Title: BGR Energy Systems Reports Reduced Q3 Net Loss
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems has reported financial results for the third quarter. The company's net loss decreased to 3.4 billion rupees, compared to a loss of 6.9 billion rupees in the same period last year. However, revenue declined significantly to 661 million rupees from 4.62 billion rupees year-over-year.

News.Title: BGR Energy Systems: ₹35-Crore Tax Demand Reversed
News.Summary: BGR Energy Systems Ltd received a rectification order from the Assistant Commissioner of GST, dropping a previous tax liability of ₹35.07 crore for the period April 2019-2020. The company now incurs no tax liability for this period.
